Description: Sherd from body of Attic red-figured pottery krater; inside glazed (fired light orange-red) with reserved band near top; exterior, dancing maenad to right, wearing girded peplos, right arm raised; white for flesh and hair ornament; part of tray to left, loaded with white objects and ribbons; rosette filling ornament below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1155)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 31, pl. 30, 13)
